answerText: asthenosphere[10] These types of boundaries, exemplified by the Mid-Atlantic Rift and the Great Rift Valley, are locations where the magma wells up from the asthenosphere. They are often locations of volcanism.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Irvine and Michigan State A | 3 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The American geophysicist Thomas Jordan has suggested that the bases of tectonic plates intrude deep into this layer, thus impeding their movement.  [10] This highly viscous though solid portion of the upper mantle supports the lithosphere and exhibits a characteristic low-velocity zone.
